raw_response:
Thought: To check if a number is prime, we need to verify that it is greater than 1 and has no divisors other than 1 and itself. We can do this by iterating from 2 up to the square root of the number and checking for any divisors. If a divisor is found, the number is not prime; otherwise, it is prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1

  (2..Math.sqrt(num).to_i).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end

final_answer(answer: is_prime?)
```
